column4: what's better? sharing a fat32 partition between winXP and Ubuntu or an ext3 (I have a driver for XP that can read/write ext3)?
the fat32 method is better  (depend on windoze for nothing)
are you wanting to access the drive from windoze and linux?
then i'd recommend the fat32 method (i don't want windows having the ability to read/write to my linux stuff)
it would be a shared partition, just for data..
bluefoxicy, Hentai: this is the driver: http://www.fs-driver.org/download.html - it was reviewed in the german c't magazine.
bluefoxicy i dont recommend enabling windows to read/write to your linux stuff
as said, it's just a data partition thingie.
using only linux, ext3 is great, but having other non-*nix OS' sharing is diffecult
that is a very good question
have you checked your md5s on the disc?
k3b has checked them before burning, will do it now with the image.
yes ubuntu likes to be burned sloooowly for tasty ubuntu goodness
damn, the .iso torrent was not completely received by azureus.. another one has finished and I did not look close enough.. %-/
